main event: On July 22, 1966, a civilian reported sighting a bright object in the sky in Hedgeville, West Virginia, which was observed for approximately 20 minutes.
interesting points: The object appeared round and was described as having a brilliant bright light around its outer edge., Witness reported it was stationary and did not move during the entire observation period., The sighting reportedly occurred just before dawn when it still maintained brightness., The observer noted that the object resembled the size of a dinner plate., The object was visible clearly despite the approaching dawn and had no noise associated with it.
sighted object: a bright round object with a brilliant light edge
witness description: civilian, female, observed the object at ground level
